website_summaries.verdict: This value-priced router gets the job done, delivering more than enough speed for basic streaming and internet use.
pros: Lightweight but capable of handling multiple devices throughout the home
Built-in firewalls and simple management and control features
cons: Not as powerful as some models

customer_reviews.title: The MediaLink AC1200 Has a VPN Too
customer_reviews.text: We tried several routers, including several very expensive products, and by far the Medialink AC1200 is the best. Super easy to set up and use, excellent Wi-Fi that one can TURN OFF when not needed, and unbeknownst to us, only because there is no mention of this feature in the Amazon description of this router, the Medialink AC1200 has a VPN included too. So if you are turned off because this router does not show a VPN feature - it's included, Amazon just doesn't have it listed.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Muleskinner

customer_reviews.title: Fraud! Not Broadcom chipset!
customer_reviews.text: When I got the router I noticed the power adapter output is 12V 1.5A where Broadcom version should use 12V 2A output. Thus I dissembled the router and found out it is using Realtek chipset!! See picture. MediaLink Ac1200 is OEM by TENDA who is also selling this model under TENDA brand. The current retail price for TENDA Realtek version AC1200 is $23. This is disgusting!
customer_reviews.author: jolly

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This little router is amazing. Great interface—simple, quick, intuitive. Wireless coverage: as expected—if not, better. I upgraded my parents’ network from a dinky d-link with internal antennas. This Medialink router covers their farmhouse and provides the easy connectivity for handheld devices and SMART TV. Well done, Mediabridge! Edit: testing our network via Gibson’s firewall test, all ports are stealthed, but the test fails because it responds to ICMP ping. Even though this option is disabled in the firmware. Docked two stars for this.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: WiFi keeps dropping connection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router 2 weeks ago and it keeps dropping my WiFi connection constantly. My work station is like 2 feet away from the router and constantly the WiFi keeps disconnecting/reconnecting , i don't like that because when i am in the middle of my work which requires internet connection i am constantly being disconnected from WiFi. The router i am speaking about is: "Medialink AC1200 Wireless Gigabit Router" Model: MLWR-AC1200
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, easy peasy setup
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit as I needed to improve my internet connection to the backyard. The first one was not only for my front yard but all the way across the street to our community pool where I can work on nice days. Again, I took out of the box, followed instructions, and was up and running in less than 5 minutes. They're follow-up emails letting me know as to whom to contact and where to go for help is second to none. They simply are the best. It really should be this simple to set up and this company proves it. Thanks, guys and gals!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Dead after two months
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I liked it at first, but after two months, it became defective and won't hold connect. Drops every 4 minutes and requires restart. Outside of return window now. What a joke. Buy a reputable router please.
customer_reviews.author: SilentStorm

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great support
customer_reviews.text: I am using this router as a universal repeater and it does exactly what I need it to do, at a very reasonable price. I had a little difficulty setting it up (I usb'd to my laptop but did not turn off wifi and this confused things) but when I called Medialink, I got great help. The phone was immediately answered by a human, Tim T., who walked me through exactly what I needed to do to complete the setup. Others have complimented this company's customer service, and my experience bears this out.
customer_reviews.author: jbmitchell999

customer_reviews.title: drop connection
customer_reviews.text: as soon as this arrived I hooked it up and take around 5-10 minutes to set up the router very quick and easy, ran a speed test right of the bat NOT impressed , its about the same thing with my old router I have almost 6 years ago, speed @69-72Mgps. But the wifi signal coverage was awesome its covered my whole house@ 1150 SQ which I could've keep this unit if its not for keeping drop on connection every 15 - 20 minutes, sometime even less then that, its just annoying that you kept trying to reconnect to it again in every 5-10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: It’s junk, don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Don’t buy it. After only two months it stopped working! I replaced an old router that we had for 3 years because it could no longer support the number of wireless devices in our home. After installation the media link was working great, then about 4 weeks later it stopped sending a signal with no explanation for why, I reset to factory settings and we were back in business. Came home last night and again no signal, it is receiving because I’ve checked our modem and it’s working. I’ve tried resetting but nothing is working. I will never buy this brand again. Complete Junk!
customer_reviews.author: STEVE MCGANNON

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: This Router was extremely easy to install. I followed the instructions and it was up and running in no time. I brought up my laptops (2), nest learning thermostat, brother laser printer, Samsung Galaxy Note 3, Amazon Fire TV Box. As this is a simultaneous 2.4/5 ghz router, I have my Amazon Fire TV Box using 5 ghz and the rest of my WIFI products using 2.4 ghz. My home is 1500 sq feet with no problems. I have been contact several times via email by the Mediabridge Customer Service group and felt that if I needed there help they were just a phone call away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the AC1200. We recently upgraded our home security system, and we’re both gamers so we decided to upgrade my 7yo router that had been super slow. This router bumped my 20mbps down 5mbps up WiFi to 60-90mbps down and 10-15mbps up. Over 189mbps download when hard wired. I just did a test on WiFi on my phone at the farthest point from our router and it’s still 57mbps down and 10 mbps up. For reference we have three laptops, two iPhones, two PlayStations, and three security cameras hooked up to our WiFi which runs on Spectrum cable.
customer_reviews.author: Socks

customer_reviews.title: This is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This is GREAT! Being a very low tech person, I had to contact the company for assistance in setting it up. The person who assisted me was kind and patient and very knowledgeable. He helped me set it up as a Range extender which was what I needed. The process was easy with his help and didn't take long at all. I now have excellent strength wifi throughout my home. I am so happy. I highly recommend this company and this product!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Mclane

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for ANY type of parental control features. Buy the TP-Link AC1200 instead...
customer_reviews.text: You are allowed 10 keywords to utilize for Parental controls, what a JOKE! They do NOT specify this in the description. This is basically false advertisement. This router is NOT for you if you have children. My sons friend was able to easily bypass the PATHETIC 10 KEYWORDS control and teach my son about pornography. As far as tech support?? They guy argued with me that this is not the fault of the router, but my fault for not entering keywords properly in 10 comma separated spots.. The router also randomly dropped connection. I could get past that, but not past their falsely advertised parental controls. Take heed with the message I'm leaving you here.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Ripke

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ROUTER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router yesterday. It worked great for a few hours. Then it disconnected completely. We turned the router off and back on again. Today, it worked, no problems at all until tonight. It would connect for a few seconds and then disconnect. It never stopped doing this until it just finally stopped working completely about an hour later. Even the wired connections had the same problem. My advice is to avoid this router and buy another one. It doesn’t help that their customer service/tech support is closed on the weekend. Now we’re without internet until our new router arrives Monday evening. (Today is Saturday.)
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: despite being pretty tech savvy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months back and, despite being pretty tech savvy, could not get it to work correctly. It was a busy time, so I put it aside and just came back to try it again. Despite spending hours on it over a few days, and despite the fact that it claims to be working, it still does not. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: Purshased 2 to extend my home wifi. Setting it as a main router and a bridge was easy. The web setting page is really friendly but don't support HTTPS. Had to exchange the second one because faulty firmware. Mediabridge support was easy to work with. Update: Work fine for 6 months. The main router began to have random connectivity issues on the 5Ghz band. Have to reboot several time during the day. Some times 5ghz shows as "broadcasting" with exellent signal but will not let the device connect to it. Contacted Mediabridge support for warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jorg

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I bought this router to take advantage of ...
customer_reviews.text: You can take this with a grain of salt. So far so good. I bought this router to take advantage of my new Fiber internet connection which my old router was unable to handle. My first speedtest was insanely high, see photo. My wifi connection in my apartment is better than it was before. Previously it would go in an out in the bathroom (its a small apartment so that was pretty disappointing) now it works fine as it should. Install was of course very easy. I've only been using it a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: howardtaft

customer_reviews.title: will not connect to modem
customer_reviews.text: just received , no internet, simple to setup but no connection on wan even if clone mac address like said and reboot all in order they want, waiting and waiting even longer than they said to connect the next device..... junk, reconnected my old wifi router, no problems at all. frustrating and tech support eastern closed at 2p pacific when I tried of course.... I would try the tp link I was looking at against this medialink,,, will be returning this 1200ac
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I want to praise Mediabridge's customer service. I ordered a Medialink router. It is ridiculously easy to install and works really well. Unfortunately, the first one I got started acting up after a few days. I was able to get through to Mediabridge's customer service instantly. The tech support person was friendly, accommodating, and spoke American English. They shipped me a new router with a return label for the old one. It arrived in two days, along with a bluetooth speaker as an apology for having shipped a defective product. The new router works perfectly. I really value great customer service, and based on my experience, would be inclined to buy Mediabridge products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: wens

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement over old router
customer_reviews.text: My old router was giving me d/l: 40Mbps, u/l: 100 Mbps (I know, never knew I would have faster upload speeds...wired), 10Mbps maybe on wireless d/l. This router easy to set up, now I get d/l: 327Mbps, u/l: 60-80Mbps (wired), d/l: 292Mbps, u/l: 40Mbps (wireless) Old router didn't allow wireless to automatically connect, consistently dropped and had to be rebooted. Additional features nice on my router. NewEnglandClamRouter.... old yeller had to be put down....
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Timmons

customer_reviews.title: No signal dropping while streaming audio
customer_reviews.text: While I have many years of connecting components and devices, I can't remember a time when everything worked the first time. My fault entirely as I don't always understand instructions. This Medialink was easy to set up, directions were clear, and the color coding is always a big help. My previous router dropped signal constantly when streaming audio which was annoying. So far the only time this happens with the Medialink is if I'm standing in from of the radio. There was no necessity to contact customer service but it was offered through two very nice emails. I've no doubt help would have been readily available had I needed it. Overall I am extremely pleased with this router.
customer_reviews.author: A. Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: HotSpot repeater function
customer_reviews.text: I tried many of the other brands of wifi routers as a repeater for my cellular phone's HotSpot, but they didn't perform reliably. This MediaLink wifi router has worked flawlessly for the past month. Setting it up as a repeater is as easy as logging into the router, selecting the repeater function, choosing your Hotpot, and entering the necessary password to connect to it. I don't have a broadband option for internet where I live other than satellite, but I do have 4G LtE service. Internet speeds have been an acceptable 45-65 Mbps using this as a wifi repeater and works perfect for what I use it for. Another plus is that it isn't expensive as some of the others.
customer_reviews.author: GKAtascosa

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for...doesn't always apply...
customer_reviews.text: Tired of paying for rental of modem for your cable provider? I bought my own and added this router with tremendous wifi signal. i have tried several routers and this one is top notch. The signal is strong enough to reach the front yard and back patio area. My neighbors have even said they see it broadcast-ed in their house. Set up is very easy. Instructions are included on setup. Just plug in and follow instructions on your connected computer or phone, either wired or wireless, and your up and running. There are more expensive units out there but why pay more if you can get a better product. Recommend 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Holy Cow!  So impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Holy Cow! So impressed. Went from Netgear Nighthawk to this. INCREDIBLE difference. So much faster. Easier to set up! I connected 20 devices in like 20 minutes. PS4, XBOXone, IPADs, iPhones, 4 laptops, Macbook Air, Craftsman Assurelink Garage, HUE Lights, Roku's, Zwave lights, NEST. All devices connected at 5G and you can rename them on a fly in the router in the device list if you desire. SO totally AWESOME. I am an IT professional for 19 years. Signal is strong in two story 2700 SF house. Router is in my basement. Roku's working perfectly two stories up streaming PLEX and Netflix. Best WiFi i've had. I'm not getting a dumb Eero for $400 or Google SpYFi.
customer_reviews.author: Boo Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great router for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem at my house and I didn't even know it. My ISP had upgraded my service to a 200mb connection six months ago but I had completely forgotten that the wired ports on my old Router were only 10/100. I looked all over for an affordable all in one solution for a while before finding this Medialink AC1200 Wireless Gigabit Router. I had never heard of the company before but decided to try them out. The gigabit wired connections work as advertised, the wireless is more than enough to cover my apartment, and it was very easy to setup. I highly recommend this device!
customer_reviews.author: Oozlefinch

customer_reviews.title: Useless, piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Only allows automatic setup. I want to use it as an access point, which it does allow, but you can’t change the ip to keep it on my lan. So I let it do it’s automatic setup, and it worked ok for a while. After a little over 3 months it just starts resetting over and over. Now the support window has expired already. If you want to throw $50 out the window, either buy this router, or save some time and drive down the street throwing 5 $10 bills out the window, it’s probably more fun. I have to buy a linksys now to replace this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: M. B.

customer_reviews.title: High power, high value wireless router.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty easy to set up, and if you haven't updated your router in a while, you will definitely notice an improvement in performance. There's a little bit of a delay between entering your settings and set up completion, so if you think you've done everything right and it isn't working, just leave it plugged in for a few minutes. If it still doesn't work after 30 minutes, you probably need to troubleshoot, but before that, just leave it alone.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Hoadley

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wireless router because its supposed to provide a strong wifi signal and I was hoping to use it to replace my netgear router. But then I tested the download and uploads speeds in one of the corners of my house that gets a weak signal and found that the strenght of the 2.4 and 5 Ghz channels on this router were extremely poor. I’ll be keeping my netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Returned item sold to me, didn’t work. Missing Cables
customer_reviews.text: When I first receive this item I was super excited for it because I would finally have high speed internet. Well I get home open my package and noticed right away the power cord isn’t there. I didn’t care about it first but then I connected it with another one I had around the house and set it up. It didn’t work I tried searching on all my devices trying to find the WiFi name.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Tamez

customer_reviews.title: Top notch router
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze. This replaces a five year old Medialink router that served us well. With our gradual shift to a Smart House, we needed more capability. We are using all four wired connections plus seven smart devices with no problems. Company seems anxious to see that we have a positive experience with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: rees*pieces

customer_reviews.title: Medialink Does it Right for Price and Functionality
customer_reviews.text: This router has made an amazing difference from the previous Mediabridge router that was a few years old. Coverage is throughout the house and yard, so I won't need to try and convert my old router to an extender. The price was right as well. Rather than pay $300+ for a system with extenders, this router does the trick in a large home. At $59, it can't be beat, and the dual band works as advertised. Tech support was also very responsive via email when I asked questions about the extender functionality.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! just WOW!! The most reliable wifi router ever. I love the 5G option for devices and also guess wifi option that you can enable/disable. Awesome device for the price. recommended for those out there whi may have same experience as me that has problem with your ISP modem router built-in wifi which so unreliable for streaming and gaming. if you are gamer, I can Guaranteed you can tell the difference when you play online MMORPG. I have not lag ever since.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Could not get my mobile devices connected. No avenue to get support from company. Had to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: We have a wifi antenna on our roof because we live out in the country and can't get service from the big providers. We have struggled with different routers for ten years now, and this Medialink router has helped solve our problems! We have six phones going almost all the time plus a main computer being used from morning until night. We are very happy with the improved coverage. Simple set-up and great wifi reception now! We are happy!
customer_reviews.author: ninemommer

customer_reviews.title: We are getting crazy speeds with this even with the router in the basement
customer_reviews.text: We got rid of our Comcast modem which was also a router. I was expecting the same speeds after the update. With the router located at the same place as the old Comcast hardware, our speeds have increased from 30-50 to 90-200+ (depending on exactly where you are) We have not had to reboot the router yet either after a month of use (if my memory serves me correctly, this modem lets you do an auto-reboot every day at a scheduled time in the middle of the night) No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: G. Eberly

customer_reviews.title: Who could ask for more?
customer_reviews.text: This router could not have been easier to set up. It worked perfectly out of the box. Appears to be well designed, as is the Mediabridge utility to control it. It has been in service for a week now with no issues. It is worth a 5 star review, especially when compared to other available routers from which to choose....often finicky during the set up process. Speed is excellent as is the signal range. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Teichen

customer_reviews.title: Always losing connection
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible router, it constantly loses connection. I reset it at least once a day. And it is slow. If I am using wifi on computer, watching netflix on tv using wifi and someone is using the wifi on their phone, it cannot handle the traffic and slows everything down. The picture while netflix or amazon prime is blurry at times due to the slow speed of the modem. If I could return it for a refund I would. It worked well for the first 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Earthrains

customer_reviews.title: A WHOLE WORLD OF IMPROVEMENT
customer_reviews.text: Since our local ISP decided to go all digital, we now need to stream our TV shows. When I first hooked up a streaming player, the picture quality was very poor , blurry with freezes. But after installing my new Medialink router, the picture has been spectacular 99% of the time. Browsing the Net on our computers has also become much faster. When I was doing my research on routers, my main criterion was 5-star reviews. I was amazed to find that the router with the best reviews was also one of the lower priced ones. So---win/win ! BTW-- I also bought and installed a new wi-fi extender and improved our access even more.
customer_reviews.author: David Alan Haney

customer_reviews.title: dead after 1 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine router initially, very fast wired and wireless connections, but it lost the ability to connect out to the modem from my ISP. It was intermittent at first, thought it was just dropped wifi on my ps4, but I was wrong, today(5/15/2020) it dropped its connection to the internet permanently for both wired and wireless connections. Removed this device from the chain and everything worked fine on all devices. I would expect a router with this price tag to be longer lasting. 18 months just is not enough. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Continuously drops 2.4 ghz connection
customer_reviews.text: My 2.4 Ghz signal continuously drops. I had earlier complained to the tech support for this product and they sent me a replacement, which is a good thing on their part, but then after a few days of smooth operations, even the second piece started dropping the 2.4 Ghz signal. And now the support and return window is closed and I am stuck with this junk. Stay away, spend appropriate amount of money and find something better.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: This was the answer for my internet connection problem
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks of bad advise about how to fix my connection problems I ordered the Medialink AC-1200 wireless router and it solved my internet issues. I am not computer savvy so after a failed attempt or two to set it up (totally operator error) I called the supplier and Tim walked me through it. The bottom line is, The unit works great; faster and much more reliable than past routers. It sits upright so I'm guessing overheating will be less of an issue too. The customer service is super. They are understanding, patient and generally good folks. I recommend this router for a home network set up and I also ordered the 4 year warranty. Bill
customer_reviews.author: William Bettag

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer.
customer_reviews.text: Goes fantastic with my Motorola 16x4 cable modem Mod MB7420 no configuration issues. I did I lot of reading reviews here on Amazon and glad I did. Lots of good info in those reviews. Does all I need it to do. No issues so far in two weeks of owning it. Using it with my second gen Fire Stick, and latest Chrome cast. Reaches every room in my 1800 square foot home. I should have gotten on with more than 4 Ethernet port but that's what they make switches for. Oh and amazon services and delivery on point. Love Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Snave

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional customer service and tech support. Great router too.
customer_reviews.text: This router has the most user-friendly interface and setup in any router I've had so far, and has worked reliably from the day I bought it. I had a problem with my internet way after the 30-day return policy and I e-mailed them thinking it was a router issue. They replied very quickly in every email while I tried their suggestions, even telling me they would replace it if we couldn't get it to work (again, this was many months after I bought it) and finally I got it to work with their suggestions, when all my research and even my ISP couldn't help me.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C. Ocasio

customer_reviews.title: Tech support rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Forget the router - it works. The service and support are incredible. I've purchased routers from Medialink over the years, and one 5-year old one died. I ordered the new router, follow the simple instructions, and finally was faced with a question I didn't understand. I called, the tech explained what to check, and bingo - it's up. The tech stayed on the phone and worked with me to solve a Roku problem. In a few minutes, hours of time were saved. Support is off the chart. Many, many, many thanks to the techs of Medialink and for the designers of a great product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Able to handle our multiple systems without slowing down
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our other router needed to be reset at least once a day and up to five times a day and we were sick of it! After reading all the great reviews we decided on this router and couldn't be happier! My husband was able to set it up in less than 5 minutes and it was up and running. We have four gaming systems, three-four cell phones and multiple laptops using this router at a time and it hasn't gone out or slowed down at all. We are so very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: lvrdsx

customer_reviews.title: WiFi keeps disconnecting.  This is useless as a range extender.
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a range extender with my FIOS Quantum Gateway router... The signal on the MediaLink appears to be strong and steady until BOOM, connection suddenly drops for several seconds. It's frustrating enough to the point where I'm just using the original router at full distance and dealing with "Fair" 5G signal strength instead of the "Good" I get from the MediaLink. Very disappointing, I wish I'd read the comments because it's too late to return it at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Raheen B

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a much older medialink router that had started dropping off multiple times a day. I’m so glad I picked another medialink. The directions were easy, and logging into my account online was super easy too. I received 2 follow up emails asking if I was doing ok with the setup and if I needed anything or had any questions, I could call medialink customer service. My speeds are great with the new router and no more dropping of my signals. Very pleased! Would definitely recommend this router to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennacat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, fast and strong
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and great reception. This replaced a very good "n" router which finally failed, and this router is faster and has a stronger signal (penetrates walls in my house very well). I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AvatarDad

customer_reviews.title: Great for 100 mbps down/5 mbps connection in a 1-story house
customer_reviews.text: Have had a Netgear C3700-100NAS cable modem/router combo for a couple of years. The wifi range and connectivity decreased over time, but got dramatically worse after a recent move. After doing some research, I decided to take a chance on this router. Right before adding the Medialink router, I clocked my internet connection at 12 mbps (on a 100 mbps connection). Added the router, turned off the Netgear's router function, and - voila - 89 to 119 mbps! Went from several dropped connections a day to none at all! Wifi access range expanded greatly. I have only had this router for a week or so. Hopefully this is not a fluke; fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: Manon

customer_reviews.title: Connects with Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: I love this router(at the moment)because it does what it claims. I live in a highly congested area. My WiFi would drop with the previous ASUS wireless router even though I live in a 800sq foot unit. I searched amazon and decided to look into this after a reviewer claimed the Medialink was really good. After reading likes and dislikes I took the bait. So far I am extremely pleased. Like one reviewer said he couldn’t set his own password due to the particular firewall and had to disconnect it. Same issue here. That’s why I gave it 4 stars. It works with Spectrum. I have a solid and fast connection. Hopefully it won’t change any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: It'sonlyme

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I'm using my Medialink router in my two-story home which has an "in law" apartment on the front. We are able to get Wi-Fi through the entire house. We stream video on two different devices, plus surf the web, all simultaneously with no problems. The instructions which came with it were clear, and set up was easy and straightforward. Medialink sent us an email immediately after our purchase which included their contact phone number just in case we had problems. I didn't need to use the number, but it gave me peace of mind to receive it knowing they were willing to stand by their product.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: Good if you don't mind managing via stupid insecure HTTP
customer_reviews.text: Good : coverage and shouted are excellent. Able to stream to multiple TV's at the same time. Bad : haven't found anything yet. Horrifying : Mediabridge it's 2017. HTTP is stupid insecure. Make your product use HTTPS.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Disconnecting n restarting by itself
customer_reviews.text: My internet keep getting disconnected, like every 2 to 4 minutes... the route will keep restarting by itself. I have high expectations for his, but disappointed for real. I think it is default, I will send it back tomorrow,, I just have it for few hrs n this is what happening all day.
customer_reviews.author: solo

customer_reviews.title: Medialink AC 1200
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Medialink AC1200 to replace a Belkin N600. We have 100 mps service with Spectrum. With the Belkin connected to the modem, I was only receiving 80 mps. Now with the Medialink, I am receiving 120 mps. The wifi coverage for our 2400 sq ft home is excellent through out. When I run a speedtest I recieve 70 to 120 mps, depending how far away you are from the router. I watch my beloved Redsox from the MLB.TV app on a firestick. With the old router I had constant buffering. With the medialink, it has not buffered once. Highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Bill OGDEN

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping the wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to replace an old Airport Extreme. This replacement was extremely frustrating to someone who has reasonable tech skills. After successfully setting up, it dropped the connection after 15 minutes. Several reboots later, and connection continuing to drop, or not work even though it looked successful, the final reboot, and the connection lasted about an hour--just long enough to re-set numerous Alexa devices with the new device name and p/w. I'm sending it back after less than 24 hours. And I get to re-set all those devices again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I'm technically challenged
customer_reviews.text: I had issues getting this set up. Not because of the directions.... Those were simple. It was literally stupid issues on my end. I know I could have called. I got the email offering help if I need it and I think that is awesome. But I know myself and knew it was something I was doing wrong. I had been having trouble steaming a peloton class off my tablet. It kept freezing. I also couldn't get good signal in my room. This did the trick. I can even see the image more clear on my tablet. Very happy i switched my old ancient router out. But why is my password have the words "green come" in it? Ew. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Stopped dropping my wi-fi connection!
customer_reviews.text: I use VPN to work from home and my last router was dropping several times a day - only for a few seconds, but enough for my VPN to notice and take several additional minutes to reconnect. Not a big issue unless I am presenting my screen and I look like an idiot when everything goes blank. SO HAPPY with this new router. Been installed for a week and nothing has dropped yet - versus 2-10 drops per day with the last guy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not computer savvy and when the cable guys said my router was too old and slow I ordered this one. I couldn't be happier. With no computer knowledge I was able to hook this up in 5 minutes. It works great and is so much faster connection. If you are like me and know nothing about networks then get this router. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WVGUNS

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement to our WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Our previous router was relatively old and a Comcast technician had pointed out it had a problematic record from what he'd seen. We ordered this product after a bit of online research. It came super fast from Amazon. It was reasonably easy to set up following the instructions and plugging the same holes the old one was plugged into! The performance has been excellent with superior speed and very few if any WiFi interruptions. We feel a bit foolish that we put up with the old router (which was awful in comparison) as long as we did.
customer_reviews.author: NJB

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and I have tested it with six different devices at the same time and it worked beautifully. I've had it a month now and no problems at all. We lost power a few times and it was up and running again in no time, whereas my previous router took a few minutes. I haven't had to contact tech support but it's comforting to know they are in the US. The last one was in India I think and it was very hard to communicate. That does make a difference. And it's a nice looking router, too. I wish I had bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: BrinDana

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the name fool you!
customer_reviews.text: This Router is a beast. I replaced it with my Netgear with the 3 antennas which really didn't work at all. I decided to give the Medialink a try because of the great review. Well it's all true and my W-Fi is faster and I did a test and the numbers flew. I wasn't paid to give my review but I want to give this company a shout out on a great product. My Netgear Router is free if anyone wants it.. Also I had a question and I was contacted right away
customer_reviews.author: Terrance G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: The unit will not connect to some web sites. If I remove the router and go directly to the modem I can connect to the web sites. Power resets do nothing. No applicable firmware updates for this model. I feel that for 60 bucks it should last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: High quality good features
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older router/modem combo with a separate modem and this router. The result was improved connectivity and great clarity on video. Easy to set up. I was able to create a network for personal use, another for friends who visit, and a separate one for my printer. They all work flawlessly. We had been watching Babylon 5 reruns on a streaming service and the video clarity was terrible. After setting up this router I was amazed at the improvement in quality. Didn’t need to contact support because it set up easily. Was impressed that they sent an email offering support if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: sny

customer_reviews.title: Nope.. Just no
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router because it looked nice, had the gigabit on it. Gigabit ain't worth a monkies uncle if it doesn't stay connected. It drops all of my non hardwired divises at least a few times a minute when connected. What is the purpose of a router if not to stay connected? Don't buy I'm going to have to suffer until I can afford a new one. Ps for the ac1200 since they mix all the reviews into one.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan b.

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an older lady with NO computer training. I needed a new router and searched for reasonably priced ones with good reviews. I selected this Medialink and am so happy that I did. As I said, I'm not comfortable with my computer abilities. I set this up myself (I have no in-house help with these things). I'm sure it took me a little longer than it would for someone who knows what they're doing, but it didn't take me all that long. And things were up and running without a hitch. The directions that came with it were clear. I give this router five stars! Thank you Medialink!
customer_reviews.author: Cyn

customer_reviews.title: Simple Set-up, Fast Internets!
customer_reviews.text: After more than 15 years I broke down and bought a new router. The difference is drastic. It’s like a had dial-up all these years. How was I even functioning? This unit was simple to install provided (I imagine) you read the directions and follow them. I set this up using a computer. Top to bottom, from the moment I opened the box to being LIVE & wireless took 10 whole minutes. I now have fast internets!
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: How is this rated so high?
customer_reviews.text: Barely holds a connection. Nothing but trouble drops internet have to completely reset the router to be able to connect again. Bought this based on the reviews, I'm so disappointed. Beware of this and the Tenda AC1900 they are basically the same thing. I'm on Spectrum and its been a giant headache since day one. Spend more for better and alleviate some stress in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: gahjr

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi and simple set up
customer_reviews.text: My old wifi broke suddenly after 3 years and I was without TV firesticks and Roku), and Internet to my laptop, tablet and phone. I went online and researched best moderately priced WiFi boxes and this got good ratings. Right out of the box ,I had it up and running within 10 minutes. Seamless....works fine a few days later, no issues. Satisfied customer. As internet speeds increase and we use data more, it seems three years old renders most electronics obsolete, so this was much needed anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Karen kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Fast, good range...so far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my Netgear after upgrading it's firmware basically turned it into a brick, so I purposely chose this Medialink because it was not on the list of routers possibly affected by the Russian hack earlier this year. It was a breeze to set up and I was online in no time. Since, I'm regularly pulling download speeds above 200 Mbps with my Galaxy Note 5 connected to the 5G network. Range is great. Granted, I live in a small single level home, but I can walk over to the house across the street and still maintain a good connection. Product arrived in perfect condition and on time. Medialink, you turned a diehard Netgear fan into a believer!
customer_reviews.author: pianodude63

customer_reviews.title: Easy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10...Extremely easy to install and setup. Plugged it in, added a password and I was done. This replaced a Linksys router when I upgraded to a Comcast 1 gig modem. I have had great experiences with Linksys, but the price differential was enough to give this a try. Happy that I did so. It hangs off a cat 5 cable to the Comcast router three floors below. Only seeing a little less that 800 gps, but very happy with that the considering how it is setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: I looked through hundreds of reviews when trying to find the right WiFi router to replace my old one that was dying. I am extremely happy with this router and it is definitely the best one! Easy set up and controls, directional 5G signal and a fantastic range! Additionally I had to speak with their customer service regarding a very small issue I was running in to with the parental controls and the customer service was absolutely outstanding!! I would highly recommend this router!!
customer_reviews.author: S.W.

customer_reviews.title: If you need to know who is on your network then this router is not for you.
customer_reviews.text: It has excellent coverage and performance. However If you need to know who is on your network then this router is not for you. Some attached devices just don't show up. Not intermittently. They just don't show up at all. Ever. I reached out to their support team (not too helpful) and the suggestion was to assign manual addresses (which I'm already doing) and use 3rd party scanning software, because determining connected devices can be "tricky". Every router I've ever owned has done this reliably. If you don't care about that kind of stuff then this router is ok. If you do, then coupled with anaemic user interface, I'd give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this equipment. I found the UI to be too simple and missing a ton of stuff the average or even a higher level user would need. Additionally, signal was flaky from the beginning. It had a terrbile time remaining up and seemed to restart night, which would then entail logging back in an resetting the equipment. You be better off buying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: My first unit had trouble accessing some secure sites. Secure sites I could access on other networks were inaccessible when on this router's network using the same laptop. I contacted Medialink and the walked me through several steps to try to fix the problem. When nothing helped, they shipped a new unit which is working flawlessly. A bit bummed that the unit did not function 100% out of the box but great to know that their service was terrific and the problem was swiftly corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and powerful, really nice unit at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 10-year-old wired wi-fi repeater with this unit and was amazed at how easy it was compared to the old one, and how the wi-fi signal carries through more of the house than the old one. The only small trick was that my first hub changed the address of this unit, but this was expected. Like the old unit, it seemed I had to wire directly into the unit to access the settings after it was operating as a repeater. I did not need to call tech support, but they said it was available just in case.
customer_reviews.author: William I.

customer_reviews.title: Dont be afraid to order this router
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a "named brand" guy.... Well - -after my SECOND NETGEAR router started dying (after 18 months) I decided to try something else. Looking over the reviews this router got excellent feedback and I will add my positive thoughts as well. SUPER easy to setup..... works great and most importantly I have RANGE and speed.... I actually picked up my routers signal (on 2.4 ghz) a good 200+ yards from my house when I was walking my dog. HOLY SMOKE this thing has some power.... I'd definitely buy again -- hopefully wont need to. LOL
customer_reviews.author: HappyaftertheDivorce!

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue but great tech support
customer_reviews.text: I got this router about 6 months ago, and it was great. Recommended it to everyone. Unfortunately, one night it crapped out on me. Tech support responded to my email within 12 hours, and we ultimately wound up speaking on the phone. He helped me determine that the router was not functioning properly and immediately put in an order to ship me a replacement. Got the replacement and a label to send the old one back. It's working fine. Will update if I have further issues.
customer_reviews.author: KARA CALLICOTT

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS! 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. Be sure to follow the instructions they provide base on what you need it for. There is a little tinkering that's needed and we almost missed it by not reading it fully 🤦‍♀️. They give three options on how you can use it. We're using it as a router. We live in a 2300 sqft house and have fairly good size yard, about 1/3 acre. I get 2/3 bars outside of my property so it sends the signal pretty far! Definition worth it, even better when it happens to be on sale. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Allie White

customer_reviews.title: Best WiFi Signal
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to extend wifi signal. Turn out this unit have 4 times signal strength my primary ASUS router. Now using only this unit for WiFi. Almost a year never fail.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and poor tech support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased first one on 2017, after a year and an half it died. Bought a second one that only lasted a year. Now on my third unit. Now having problems with port blocking, tried another router from different manufacturer and everything works fine but when I install this one it blocks random ports in the 500 range, contacted tech support and never got a reply. Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. At the end of the day you get what you pay. I'm done with Medialink.
customer_reviews.author: John (Rusty)

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a non-techy old guy
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to set up and get connected. Just follow the instructions and away you go. I tried to get a netgear router to work and had to return it. You were suppose to download an app to control the router, so basically you need a smart phone and the app to get the netgear router to work. This router which is faster is also simply a plug and play device. You can go on line and adjust various sittings but no smart phone app is needed and if you just accept the factory settings you do not even need to go on line. I am very happy with this medialink router and irritated at netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hansen

customer_reviews.title: This Router Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Medialink router that could not support the recent cable company Internet upgrade to 100 MBPS. I am very pleased with this Medialink AC1200 Wireless Gigabit Router. I have been using it for 2 weeks. It was very easy to set up, has good range throughout my home, operates WiFi at both 2.4g and 5g and now allows me to leverage the 100 MBPS service (the actual WiFi speed has consistently hit 135 MBPS using the 5G setting). Mediabridge tech service is good - timely responses to technical questions and customer focused. You can neither beat the value nor find a better router for a price < $100.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Brand Name does not necessarily means good. This is one good product!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the product. Set up in 5 minutes, including changing password. I have FiOS but the wireless router they gave me is junk, so I bought this and connect to the Verizon wireless router with a cable and set it up as a wireless router. Fast connection and good signal. It just works! I am techically savvy and this one job that I really feel like plug and play. It provides 2 network for you to connect, One is the 2.4 ghz, which is more steady and longer range, the other is the 5.8 ghz, faster but more prone to signal degradation because of physical barrier. I am using the 5.8 band, no problem at all!
customer_reviews.author: Ojective Analytical

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit at Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: The router set up was relatively easy, made necessary cable connections satisfactorily, and got quick connection to the internet. Coverage for single story, medium size home seems adequate. I suffered several frustrating setbacks attempting to connect my devices to the network, but that was probably a result of user blunders ;-) Since I was determined to figure it out myself, I didn't contact customer support which would, no doubt, have made the task simpler. The unit meets my needs and price was affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Zia Fan

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect 850mb/s+ on wifi
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as advertised. I am getting 950mb/s with the wired connection and only 450mb/s with the computer and phone directly next to the router on the 5gHz band, even though it advertises 850mb/s+ on wifi speeds. My wireless broadband adapter is also rated to 1300mb/s with a strong antenna. Decent router for the price, but should advertise more honestly
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement with speed and coverage
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my previous Medialink router in operation since 2011, coupled with a new Motorola 16x4 Cable Modem, which doubled my internet speeds immediately and increased my reception throughout the house. Easy setup, just follow the directions provided. I did contact Medialink via email about problems with my wireless printer who responded immediately. Printer problem was due to having a static ip address, switched to dynamic address and it fixed my wireless printer problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: this is the one
customer_reviews.text: We have tried 2 major brands of router(~ 150 USD) in last three years. The major issues we encountered was that they will loose network connectivity every few days and we have to reboot the router. Since my wife works from home, it was a big nuisance. We have been using this router for last two weeks and no connection drop, range is very good and I get fair enough signal in my backyard. I connect a USB disk to the USB port and make it as a central network storage. Netflix, Amazon Prime, remote desktop to my work place and everything else works fine across all devices and TV's without any buffering issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a good purchase until it started hanging on me. At first it started dropping things like my work related Zoom calls and Amazon Prime (it's not strictly for work.) Now it hangs up and need to be unplugged for an extended period before I can use it. It seemed like such a nice little router...
customer_reviews.author: Gary Oblock

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great as a bridge for a while
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and i was very happy for a few months but 2 things i need to mention. the first being that the usb port would not work with a 1 tb drive worked great with a 128 gb flash drive though and the second being that the bridged speed is 300 mbps well actually i guess i need to mention that after a few months the bridged router will not connect to the internet shows that it is bridged successfully but will not allow internet traffic this router may be better as a temporary solution till better equipment can be purchased
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up, Connection Has Been Stable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received the router in one day which was nice. Set it up as a wireless repeater without issues. Have not tried other features yet. Connection to my main router has been stable with good speed on 5 GHz channel but the connection distance does not reach too far. First impression is that it works as expected. Time will tell if it lasts. Customer service was good by sending me emails to offer helps if I needed. I wish that it would come with a manual. The manual I found online did not completely match the setup steps shown on the screen when I connected my laptop to the router but the setup screen was easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: SCL

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model after reading so many reviews. I had an older router (8 years old). All of a sudden one day I can no longer get Netflix on my basement tv. My router was getting weak so I replaced it with this model. It was super easy to set up and it gives me an excellent signal in my basement (router is on first floor). I can now watch tv in my basement while on my treadmill and I get a great signal from my neighbors yard.
customer_reviews.author: bc4933

customer_reviews.title: Sets up quickly, supports a lot of throughput... Sold!
customer_reviews.text: I really love it so far, works great, had it up and running in 10 Minutes, I've gone a Netgear Nighthawk, and a Netgear 6100 and they don't seem to last, so far, this one has performed well, we have (on the weekends) 18 devices connecting to it at one time, and so far its been flawless, range is really good (works outside on my patio well (the netgear did not) keep it up Medialink! if it holds up over a year, I'll be really really happy! I really like the access page to change settings, works very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Not super good ok for price
customer_reviews.text: Works ok so far. Has been about a week. Signal isnt very strong if you have a home that you have to put this is another room. Cell phone reception is poor at times unless in same room as router, but adequit. I only get 1-2 bars tops. Though the signal works good for our firestick.
customer_reviews.author: gunny colvin

customer_reviews.title: Great speed, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when we switched to Spectrum from AT&T. I already had a modem to use but I needed to upgrade my 7 year old Linksys router. This has more than satisfied our usage needs in a 5 bedroom 3200 sq foot house. I’m getting 200+ download speeds in much of the house on it’s 5G connection. Didn’t cost a lot either, I’d say buy one if you’re thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Fer Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal.
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how good this device performs. Set up it's easy, I think is somewhat preset but that makes it easier. I had expensive gaming routers this is just as good and very affordable. To access some advanced options does require some knowledge. But for everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Solid AC router for a very reasonable price, outstanding technical support
customer_reviews.text: This router is solid and reliable, and it comes at a reasonable price. Best of all, the technical support from Mediabridge is outstanding. They are responsive and knowledgeable. It is very easy to get in touch with a real person that can actually help. I originally had an issue with the URL they use to access the router settings (medialinkwifi.com). They fixed the problem in a timely manner and provided me a software updated as soon as it was available. Problem resolved! (If you use ESET antivirus, be sure to install firmware V15.03.2.17 or later).
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Need to reset daily!
customer_reviews.text: The router worked great for a few months but now it is dropping the internet almost daily! Having to reset once in a while is fine but daily is too much! Also there are no parental controls!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great router, easy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: I ran speed tests using my existing 802.11g router and a MacBook Air, and then ran the same tests once the Medialink AC1200 router was installed; my download speeds had virtually tripled in every case. Installing the router was quick, easy, and trouble free. Installation documentation was 1 page, printed on both sides. Mediabridge Products recommends you install the router using a wired connection, but state that you can also do it wirelessly. I did it wirelessly, and had absolutely no problems. Build quality and range are excellent; I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Tech support responded quickly to my question regarding reduced speed when connected via Ethernet. It was actually my cable and I replaced it for a cat 6. I haven't dug deep but it seems that configurations are less than robust but the sacrifice may be worth it for the easy of use. I am not getting great throughput range on the 2ghz this and had to move it to cover my roku device that only accepts 2ghz. Only had this for 1 mth so the jury is still out.
customer_reviews.author: pbritt

customer_reviews.title: It Solved My Problem
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Before ordering I had asked other users if it's password would be readily available for connecting to tablets, since my old Cisco Valet's password was lost, and those who responded assured me that is was right on the back of the unit, which it was. So I ordered it and got it yesterday. With great trepidation I opened the box today and followed the instructions. It went smoothly, and now my tablet is working! Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: Dale C. Fuqua

product_meta.title: Medialink AC1200 Wireless Gigabit Router - Gigabit (1000 Mbps) Wired Speed & AC 1200 Mbps Combined Wireless Speed (Part# MLWR-AC1200R)
product_meta.description: Ac Wi-Fi provides larger-home coverage with Gigabit wired connections. Avoid wireless interference with simultaneous dual Band technology. This router provides Wi-Fi coverage to many corners of a big home. You can also extend existing Wi-Fi signals With the router's universal range extender mode. The mlwr-ac1200r makes sharing across your network even simpler. Quickly access stored photos & music across devices. It supports the latest security features, to help ensure your privacy & make sure that your family is safer while online. Parents & admins can manage Internet filtering & control bandwidth for devices.
feature_bullets: 10X’S THE SPEED: Most routers in this price range have only “Fast Ethernet” ports that max out at 100Mbps. Our router has Gigabit ports to give you 1,000Mbps for lag-free 4K video streaming & gaming.
RANGE: Beamforming and 2 high powered antennas work together to cover larger homes by focusing the wireless signal directly to your device
SAFE: Robust firewall and wireless security keeps out unwanted visitors while Guest Network access gives a separate safe and secure connection to guests
FULL CONTROL: Are the router lights too bright? Turn them off! Are your kids staying online too late at night? Restrict access to only the times you want
RANGE EXTENDER: Extend any existing wireless network using the Universal Range Extender Mode to cover even larger areas & keep all your devices on the same network

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,818 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
